result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric T Eggert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

miscConds.notes: Court orders the $650.00 cash bond on file be applied to the court costs and the balance is to be refunded to the poster.  PAID IN FULL.

-Domestic Violence Counseling.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Court will allow early termination of probation after 12 months and upon recommendation of the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric T Eggert

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
1:51 P.M.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 2 and counts 1 & 3 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty pribat concurs.  Defendant concurs.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 2 and orders counts 1 & 3 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 18 months.

CONDITIONS:

-Domestic Violence Counseling
-Court costs. Court orders the cash bond on file be applied to the court costs and any balance be refunded to the poster.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Court will allow early termination of probation after 12 months and upon recommendation of the supervising agent.

Court adjourned at 2:00 p.m.

1:22 P.M.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - spoke with the defendant, requests a jury trial be scheduled.  Court sets for Status Hearing on March 8, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.  All motions and witness lists are to be filed by March 7, 2016.  Mandatory appearance.

Court adjourned at 1:24 p.m.

11:31 A.M.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant works and requests a hearing in the afternoon.  Court sets for Status Hearing on January 12, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 11:32 a.m.

2:17 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the court regarding letter from victim.  Statement by Atty Privat - needs a pretrial.  Court sets for Status Hearing on November 24, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:18 p.m.

9:58 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has received a copy of the letter from the victim and needs to get an updated offer on this matter.  Court will set for Status Hearing on October 20, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 9:59 a.m.

10:11 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - met with the defendant this morning.  Court sets for status hearing on September 14, 2015 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:12 a.m.

1:45 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court sets for Status Hearing on August 17, 2015 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:47 p.m.
No Violent or abusive contact with Nedelia A.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
No Violent or abusive contact with Nedelia A.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

1:23 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation - cash bond to continue.  Court sets bond at $650.00 cash bond and conditions of:  No Violent or abuse contact with Nedelia A.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on June 2, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:25 p.m.
